Key Match Events: Myles Turner recorded his seventh career game with 30+ points and 10+ rebounds
Indiana's second unit went to work to close the quarter with Obi Toppin and Ben Sheppard hitting back-to-back threes
Dallas trimmed its deficit to 40-37 following a Doncic triple
Indiana took a 96-95 lead into the fourth quarter after a Siakam fadeaway
Mathurin delivered a three with Doncic all up in his face with 2:12 left in the game to make it 129-120
Pre-Game Insights: Aaron Nesmith was unavailable due to injury, thrusting Bennedict Mathurin into the starting lineup
Dallas played last night, which could have affected their start
Indiana is now 3-1 in Dallas underneath Rick Carlisle since returning in 2021
Indiana has won five of the last six meetings in Dallas
Post-Match Reflections: Myles Turner expressed pride in his team's effort after the comeback win
Jason Kidd praised the team's resilience and ability to close out the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: Indiana's second unit went to work to close the quarter with Obi Toppin and Ben Sheppard hitting back-to-back threes
Indiana took a 96-95 lead into the fourth quarter after a Siakam fadeaway
Dallas went on a 9-0 run to take a one-point lead after a Spencer Dinwiddie three
Indiana's lead was 130-125 and then Haliburton was able to create just enough space and knock down a midrange jumper to put Indiana on top by seven
